metadata.job_to_be_done: Plan a trip of 4 days for a group of 10 college friends.

subsection_analysis.refined_text: Local Experiences • Boat Trip to the Calanques : Take a boat trip to the Calanques, a series of stunning limestone cliﬀs and coves along the coast. Cultural Highlights Marseille is known for its vibrant arts scene, with numerous galleries, theaters, and music venues.. Fish Market at the Old Port : Visit the fish market at the Old Port to experience the local seafood culture

This area is renowned for its diverse landscapes, from the sun-drenched beaches of the French Riviera to the rolling vineyards of Provence and the rugged Pyrenees mountains. The South of France is also famous for its cuisine, wines, and vibrant cultural scene.. The South of France, or "Le Midi," encompasses the regions of Provence-Alpes-Côte d'Azur, Occitanie, and parts of Nouvelle-Aquitaine

Renting a car is also a great option for exploring the countryside and smaller towns. Best Time to Visit : The best time to visit the South of France is during the spring (April to June) and fall (September to October) when the weather is pleasant, and the tourist crowds are smaller. Transportation : The region is well-connected by an extensive network of trains, buses, and flights

Old Port (Vieux-Port) : The heart of Marseille, the Old Port has been a bustling harbor for over 2,600 years. Basilica of Notre-Dame de la Garde : This iconic basilica, perched on a hill overlooking the city, oﬀers panoramic views of Marseille and the Mediterranean Sea. Built in the 19th century, it is a symbol of the city's maritime heritage.

Boat Trip to the Calanques : Take a boat trip to the Calanques, a series of stunning limestone cliﬀs and coves along the coast. Fish Market at the Old Port : Visit the fish market at the Old Port to experience the local seafood culture. Street Art in Cours Julien : Explore the vibrant street art scene in the Cours Julien district.
